intro: Erechtites richardianus, commonly known as the richardian ragweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is an annual herb that typically grows in disturbed soils and open areas. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are wind-pollinated, and it is known for its allergenic pollen, which can cause respiratory issues in sensitive individuals. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and have a rough texture. Erechtites richardianus is often found in wetlands and along the edges of water bodies.
